The plant site is a founding member and active supporter of the Coastal Plain Local Emergency Planning Committee.  We coordinate our plan with the San Patricio County emergency response plan.  If a major release occurs, the emergency alarm is sounded and the site's emergency control center is activated.  The site incident commander and emergency response team responds.  Community emergency responders are notified as appropriate and mutual aid agreements are exercised when necessary.  Incident investigations and corrective actions are identified and implemented.  The facility security plan meets and exceeds the Maritime Security (MTSA 105) regulations.

- Continue to improve community emergency planning and preparedness by actively supporting and leading the increased involvement and education of responders from neighboring counties and municipalities in the local emergency planning committee.
- Continue to strengthen and reinforce the strong employee mentoring program and safe work practices initiative.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
We keep records for all accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.  It is our philosophy and practice that all accidental releases are tracked to identify and correct the key cause of the event.  The Chemours Ingleside Plant has an excellent safety record and accidental release prevention history.   There has been one accidental release of a RMP regulated substances in the past 5 years that meets the RMP resubmission criteria.  The accidental release resulted in an on-site employee exposure to a RMP regulated substance that was an OSHA recordable injury.  There were no off-site impacts as a result of this accidental release.

Since site operates on a 24 hour basis, the operations personnel comprise the on-site emergency response team.  The emergency response team is led by the shift team leader who acts as the incident commander and emergency response contact. The accident prevention programs in place are in compliance wih the OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and the EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) rule.  For our efforts in safety excellence, the Chemours Ingleside Plant is recognized by the OSHA Voluntary Protection Program as a STAR Work Site since 1984.  The facility's environmental management system was ISO 14001 certified in 2003 and transitioned to RC14001 in 2019 to include environmental, health and safety, security, transportation, outreach, emergency response and other Responsible Care requirements.

It includes the requirement to choose materials of construction to provide mechanical integrity.  It incorporates extensive safety instrumentation such as alarms, interlocks, and gas detectors.  Transportation vehicles are designed for safe handling.  Maintaining Our Plant includes identifying all process safety critical equipment and performing routine inspections to ensure proper operation and mechanical integrity.  High housekeeping standards contribute to safe operation practices.  Equipment specifications meet or exceed acceptable engineering standards.  A work order and permit system is used to control maintenance on the systems.  Maintenance personnel are trained, qualified, and experienced in preventative and predictive maintenance. ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
At the Chemours Ingleside Plant we are committed to operating and maintaining our process in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as the protection of the environment.  The Chemours Ingleside Plant adheres to Corporate policies, which could be summarized as follows:
                            - All Safety and Environmental Incidents Are Preventable
                            - The Goal Is Zero - Zero Incidents, Period
                            - All Employees and Contractors Are Responsible For Their Safety
The Corporate policies are embodied in the numerous site safety and engineering procedures and guidelines.  At the Chemours Ingleside Plant, the policies are implemented through the Process Safety and Risk Management Procedures Manual and the Emergency Response Procedures Manual.  These manuals are available to all site employees electronically and with annual computer based training.
FACILITY DESCRIPTION
The Chemours Ingleside Plant consists of approximately 580 acres, located in a rural setting along Highway 361 between the cities of Ingleside and Gregory.  About 200 acres of the property is industrialized while the remaining 400 acres is used for agricultural purposes.  The industrialized area consists of a single manufacturing complex that produces ozone friendly hydrofluorocarbon refrigerant, HFC-134a,HFO-1234yf, HFO-1243zf and aerosol propellant, HFC-152a.  In the production of these products, the following RMP regulated substances are used as raw materials or intermediates or products.
- Hydrogen Chloride, anhydrous               
- Hydrogen Fluoride, anhydrous
- Difluoroethane (HFC-152a) 
- Chloroform
- Propane
